intro: Markea tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly markea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its hairy, or tomentose, foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
